Package no.geosoft.timeseriesio.json

Class TimeSeriesJsonWriter

java.lang.Object
no.geosoft.timeseriesio.json.TimeSeriesJsonWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public final class TimeSeriesJsonWriter extends Object implements Closeable
Class for writing TimeSeries.JSON entries to disk.

Typical usage: 

   TimeSeriesJsonWriter writer = new TimeSeriesJsonWriter(new File("path/to/file.json"), true, 2);
   writer.write(timeSeries);
   writer.close();
If there is to much data to keep in memory, or the writing is based on a streaming source, it is possible to append chunks of data to the last TimeSeries instance written, like: 
   TimeSeriesJsonWriter writer = new TimeSeriesJsonWriter(new File("path/to/file.json"), true, 2);
   writer.write(timeSeries);
   writer.append(timeSeries);
   writer.append(timeSeries);
   :
   writer.close();
Note that the pretty print mode of this writer will behave different than a standard JSON writer in that it always writes signal data arrays horizontally, with each signal vertically aligned.

If the time series header contains a valid dataUri property, the time series data will be written in binary form to this location.

Author:
Jacob Dreyer

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeSeriesJsonWriter

      public TimeSeriesJsonWriter(OutputStream outputStream, boolean isPretty, int indentation)
      Create a time series writer for the specified stream.
      Parameters:
      outputStream - Stream to write. Non-null.
      isPretty - True to write in human readable pretty format, false to write as dense as possible.
      indentation - The white space indentation used in pretty print mode. [0,>. If isPretty is false, this setting has no effect.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If outputStream is null or indentation is out of bounds.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If file is null or indentation is out of bounds.

    • TimeSeriesJsonWriter

      public TimeSeriesJsonWriter(File file)
      Create a time series writer for the specified file. Writing is done in pretty print mode with an indentation of 2.
      Parameters:
      file - Disk file to write. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If file is null.

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write(TimeSeriesJson timeSeries) throws IOException
      Write the specified time series.

      Multiple time series can be written in sequence to the same stream. Additional data can be appended to the last one by append(no.geosoft.timeseriesio.json.TimeSeriesJson). When writing is done, close the writer with close().

      If the header contains a valid dataUri property, the signal data will be written in binary form to this location.

      Parameters:
      timeSeries - Time series to write. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If timeSeries is null.
      IOException - If the write operation fails for some reason.

    • append

      public void append(TimeSeriesJson timeSeries) throws IOException
      Append the signal data of the specified time series.

      This feature can be used to stream data to a time series destination. By repeatedly clearing and populating the signals with new data there is no need for the client to keep the full volume in memory at any point in time.

      If the time series header contains a valid dataUri property, the signal data will be written in binary form to this location.

      NOTE: This method should be called after the time series metadata has been written (see write(no.geosoft.timeseriesio.json.TimeSeriesJson)), and the time series instance must be compatible with this.

      When writing is done, close the stream with close().

      Parameters:
      timeSeries - Time series to append to stream. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If timeSeries is null.
      IllegalStateException - If the writer is not open for writing.
      IOException - If the write operation fails for some reason.

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Append closing brackets and close the back-end stream.
      Specified by:

    • toString

      public static String toString(List<TimeSeriesJson> timeSeriesList, boolean isPretty, int indentation)
      Convenience method for returning a string representation of the specified time series instances.

      Note: If a time series header contains the dataUri property, this will be masked for the present operation so that signal data always appears in the returned string.

      Parameters:
      timeSeriesList - Time series instances to write. Non-null.
      isPretty - True to write in human readable pretty format, false to write as dense as possible.
      indentation - The white space indentation used in pretty print mode. [0,>. If isPretty is false, this setting has no effect.
      Returns:
      The requested string. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If timeSeriesList is null or indentation is out of bounds.

    • toString

      public static String toString(TimeSeriesJson timeSeries, boolean isPretty, int indentation)
      Convenience method for returning a string representation of the specified time series.

      Note: If a header contains the dataUri property, this will be masked for the present operation so that signal data always appears in the returned JSON string.

      Parameters:
      timeSeries - Time series to write. Non-null.
      isPretty - True to write in human readable pretty format, false to write as dense as possible.
      indentation - The white space indentation used in pretty print mode. [0,>. If isPretty is false, this setting has no effect.
      Returns:
      The requested string. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If timeSeries is null or indentation is out of bounds.

    • toString

      Convenience method for returning a pretty printed string representation of the specified time series.

      Note: If the time series header contains the dataUri property, this will be masked for the present operation so that signal data always appears in the returned string.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The requested string. Never null.
      Throws:
